abstract: President Obama said major economies had not acted assertively to address global economic imbalances and left little doubt that he considered China the source of the problem.
snippet: President Obama said major economies had not acted assertively to address global economic imbalances and left little doubt that he considered China the source of the problem.
lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea  The Group of 20 major economies took initial steps to address imbalances in the global economy on Friday. But they did not act as assertively as President Obama had hoped, and he left little doubt that he considered one country, China, the primary source of the problem.

headline.main: Obama Ends G-20 Summit With Criticism of China
headline.print_headline: Obama Says China’s Policy Is an ‘Irritant’ to Trading Partners
